messages.message: After giving access to google drive in aihub sandbox it redirected me to a blank page
@Xindi Xu or @Weiming Wu? I'm not sure which one of you worked on Gdrive auth
I'll look into this
@jtau how do you get to this page?

I tried searching and saw a popup saying google drive and another data source needs my access first, so I clicked google drive and got to this screen and then after continuing eventually got redirected back to platform with a blank page
Maybe @Subash built this?
I can't even search in aihub sandbox :lolcry:
@William Helmrath do you know why the upgrade in progress banner isn't showing up rn?

> I can't even search in aihub sandbox
@Xindi Xu I am not sure who built the search bar you are using. Search is now enabled only for specific orgs using env vars. It is possible that org you are using is not enabled for search
I'm using `instabase-sandbox-org`
Paul built the search bar for the new redesigned nav bar, but it looks like it doesn't check for the env vars before displaying it
OK. it's not enabled. We should really migrate this to our usual feature flag system
Can anyone add me to the org? <mailto:xindi.xu+search@instabase.com|xindi.xu+search@instabase.com>

Yea, FF system has a drawback  - If you remember we want to show search based on orgs only, not based on users. Currently, if we make Search org opt in, then internal users will start seeing in every org they use, which is not the intended experience
cc: @Aayush @margaret.tomaszczuk

@looks like you are already added via
<mailto:xindi.xu+search_org@instabase.com|xindi.xu+search_org@instabase.com>
I was able to reproduce the error:
Looks like it's unrelated to google drive. After granting access, I tried searching the same thing again, and see the same error

For posterity, the feature flag endpoint accepts a `use_ib_account` param. When set to false, it will return the feature flag settings as if the user's email does not end with `instabase.com (http://instabase.com)`. That is, it only returns the feature flag enabled for the org, not for the user.
https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/e523d8220fe4e641b2c6f260bccef1943ec593[…]ver/src/py/instabase/api_server/handler/api/v2/feature_flags.py (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/e523d8220fe4e641b2c6f260bccef1943ec5938f/webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/api_server/handler/api/v2/feature_flags.py#L24-L33)
likely, it comes from this file: webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/apps/src/aihub/pages/Search/components/SearchLogItem/MessageParser/useMessageParser.tsx
FYI in my testing I'm also getting a blank screen occasionally from a different error: https://react.dev/errors/130?invariant=130&args%5B%5D=undefined&args%5B%5D=

This looks like a known edge case - where user switches pages before response is complete. I would suggest refreshing the page after some time (so the backend completes the response & stores in DB). @Vasu FYI

Sure, it should be handled in UI better. @Aayush

Looks like new Navbar has some issues. It hides the Searchproject pages navbar (top search bar) which blocks the Search functionality.

cc: @margaret.tomaszczuk @Rakesh
^ I'll send that to the app UX refresh team

Similar issues have popped up before, we should replace all uses of `calc(100vh - <navHeight>px)` and similar height values w/ flexbox so the main content auto-grows to fill the available area under the nav

@Subash are you referring to the search bar in the top nav (screenshot 1, old UI)?

If so, we added a feature flag “Enable global search in the navigation bar” (screenshot 2). It should have the same functionality as before, but using the new Figma designs (screenshot 3).
